This is **line\\_2** within **loop\\_1** on **face\\_1**. c. Draw a line from point [0.4412, 0.4765] to point [0.0, 0.4765]. This is **line\\_3** within **loop\\_1** on **face\\_1**. d. Draw a line from point [0.0, 0.4765] to point [0.0, 0.0]. This is **line\\_4** within **loop\\_1** on **face\\_1**. **Loop\\_1** is closed consisting of 4 lines. 3. **Transform the 2D sketch into 3D** Apply the following scaling and transformation to the 2D sketch: - Scaling: 0.4765 - Euler Angles: [0.0, 0.0, -90.0] - Translation Vector: [0.0, 0.75, 0.0] 4. **Extrude the 2D sketch to generate the 3D model** Perform an extrusion of 0.7147 units towards the normal and 0.0 units in the opposite direction using **sketch\\_scale** 0.4765 on the scaled sketch. The overall dimensions of this part are: - Length: 0.4765 - Width: 0.7147 - Height: 0.4765 These instructions provide a parametric CAD model process to construct the first part of the final shape described in the given JSON data.</description>
